1.text: Job again took up his parable, and said,

2.text: “As God lives, who has taken away my right, the Almighty, who has made my soul bitter.

3.text: (For the length of my life is still in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils);

4.text: surely my lips shall not speak unrighteousness, neither shall my tongue utter deceit.

5.text: Far be it from me that I should justify you. Until I die I will not put away my integrity from me.

6.text: I hold fast to my righteousness, and will not let it go. My heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

7.text: “Let my enemy be as the wicked. Let him who rises up against me be as the unrighteous.

8.text: For what is the hope of the godless, when he is cut off, when God takes away his life?

9.text: Will God hear his cry when trouble comes on him?

10.text: Will he delight himself in the Almighty, and call on God at all times?

11.text: I will teach you about the hand of God. That which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

12.text: Behold, all of you have seen it yourselves; why then have you become altogether vain?

13.text: “This is the portion of a wicked man with God, the heritage of oppressors, which they receive from the Almighty.

14.text: If his children are multiplied, it is for the sword. His offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

15.text: Those who remain of him shall be buried in death. His widows shall make no lamentation.

16.text: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare clothing as the clay;

17.text: he may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

18.text: He builds his house as the moth, as a booth which the watchman makes.

19.text: He lies down rich, but he shall not do so again. He opens his eyes, and he is not.

20.text: Terrors overtake him like waters. A storm steals him away in the night.

21.text: The east wind carries him away, and he departs. It sweeps him out of his place.

22.text: For it hurls at him, and does not spare, as he flees away from his hand.

23.text: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
